snippet: Representative Michael G. Grimm did not initially report an expenses-paid trip to Cyprus on his Congressional financial disclosure filing though he did list a trip to Israel.
abstract: Rep Michael G Grimm of Staten Island amended his 2011 financial disclosure filing, in June 2012, to include a previously unreported trip to Cyprus that was paid for by the Cyprus Federation of America; amendment came one day after his host on the trip, Peter Papanicolaou, was arrested in Brooklyn on federal corruption charges; Grimm's lawyer, William McGinley, maintains that the June filing had no connection to the arrest.

byline.original: By ALISON LEIGH COWAN and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

lead_paragraph: Representative Michael G. Grimm did not initially report an expenses-paid trip to Cyprus on his Congressional financial disclosure filing though he did list a trip to Israel.

headline.seo: Timing of Grimm’s Report on Expense-Paid Cyprus Trip Questioned
headline.main: Congressman’s Report of Trip Is at Issue
headline.print_headline: Congressman’s Report of Trip Is at Issue
